Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (734) 395-0920.

ALLEGATION:
On 5/25/22, Youth was choked by a staff member during a restraint. Another youth
witnessed this and confirmed. Staff witnesses did not observe this.
INVESTIGATION:
A complaint was received on 5/26/22 stating Youth A alleged Staff 1 was choking
him during a restraint. One of Youth A’s peers said this was true however several
staff witnesses did not see this.
Interviews:
Youth A was observed face to face at the facility on 5/26/22. He showed this
consultant scratch marks he had on his hands.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at his school on 6/2/22 by the DHHS Worker.
This consultant participated by phone. Youth A reported him and his peers were
breaking the rules. The kids were all in the milieu when they should have been in
bed. They were playing loud music. Staff 1 came from another house to support the
staff in his house. Youth C told Youth A there was a computer in the bushes. Youth
A told the staff he had to pee and went out to get the computer from the bushes.
Staff 2 tried to take the computer from him. Supervisor told Youth A he could not pee
outside. Youth A ran back to the house and Youth B opened the door for him. Once
inside the house Youth A began to Facetime people showing them the staff and
house. Staff 1 tried to snatch the computer from him but was unable to get it. Youth
A pulled the computer closer to him and Staff 1 put her arm around Youth A’s neck.
Youth B told Staff 1 to stop choking Youth A then pushed Staff 2. Staff 1 said she
was trying to keep Youth A safe by restraining him. Staff 1 let go when Youth B was
talking to her. He could not remember if Staff 1 used one arm or both arms to choke
him. Youth A was asked about the marks he had. He stated he noticed them after
this incident with Staff 1. He did not report any marks at first. He also had a scratch
under his eye. He did show the marks to the nurse.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility, along with the DHHS worker, on
6/1/22. She reported she came on shift around 11:00 or 11:30pm as she works the
overnight shift. The house was already in crisis. Youth A had a computer that he had
hidden in the bushes outside and grabbed it when he ran outside. He came back in
the house. Youth A then took Staff 3's computer. Supervisor tried to get it from him,
but in the process, it hit her in the face. Staff 2 heard Staff 1 say not to hit
Supervisor. Staff 1 had her arm up and may have been trying to do a one-to-one
restraint, but she was not sure as everyone was so close together. Staff 2 tried to
get Youth B away, so she did not see anything else.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/1/22 along with the DHHS
Worker. She reported she came in at 10:30pm to work the night shift. When she
3

came in the music was blasting and three youth were up in the living room. Staff 4
was helping another youth by getting him strawberries to eat. She did not see any of
the incident between Youth A and Staff 1.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/1/22. She stated Youth A
had a computer and was on social media. Staff 2 and Staff 4 were there. She saw
Staff 1 shove Youth A to get the computer from him. Staff 1 then had her arms
around Youth A's neck choking him against the wall. Staff 1 had one arm around
Youth A's neck and one arm down. The arm that was down was pushing Youth B
away. Youth B pushed Staff 1's arm away. When Staff 1 stopped holding onto Youth
A, Youth A was going to hit Staff 1 but Youth B stopped him. Youth B did not know if
Youth A had any injuries. She stated she "dates" Youth A.
The Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/1/22. She reported she
saw Youth A on 5/25 and 5/26. She saw him again yesterday and he did not have
any concerns. She said he had marks on his hands from punching things and a
scratch under his eye that he did not know how he got. She was not aware Youth A
alleged a staff choked him. She usually sees the Incident Reports and then
responds but she never saw an incident report regarding the allegations.
The Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/1/22.
He reported Youth A did not have a safety plan but was given increased checks due
to his behaviors. Youth A has broken windows, a vehicle, and punched walls.
Youth A's therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/1/22. Therapist
checked in with Youth A on Thursday. She did see the injuries to his hands and
thought they were from the property destruction he did. She reported the other kids
are afraid of him and he instructs them to do things they should not do.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/1/22. She reported she came
in to work at 11pm to work the overnight shift. She was working in a different house
when someone called for support, so she went over to Youth A's house. When she
got there, she saw all but one of the youth were up and in the living room. Music was
playing and the youth were on a laptop on Messenger talking to someone. A lot was
going on at the time. Staff 3 walked into the house with another laptop and Youth A
took it. Supervisor grabbed for the computer and Youth A swung around hitting
Supervisor with the laptop. Staff 1 wanted to create space between Supervisor and
Youth A so she put Youth A in a one-to-one hold but she could not get her hand on
his back. She turned him toward the wall to keep him away from the other staff. Staff
1 said Youth A was facing the wall. She did not know that Youth A still had one of
the laptops in his hand. She saw the laptop when she released him. The laptop kept
her from being able to do a complete hold. Youth A’s arms were too far forward due
to holding onto the laptop that Staff 1 was unable to get her arm around to place it
under Youth A’s armpit and place her hand on his back. Youth B then came and
pulled Youth A away. She believed Youth A was upset because she embarrassed
4

him in front of his girlfriend. Staff 1 did not believe her arm was anywhere near Youth
A's neck. Youth A did not have any marks on him.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/1/22. She reported she
had been with Youth A outside for two hours as he was upset and in crisis. When he
went into the house he turned music on. He had gotten a laptop from the bush
outside and began to Facetime showing people on Facetime the house. They were
weighing the risks of the youth having the computers or taking them away. Staff 3
came into the living room with a laptop and Youth A grabbed it. Youth A had two
laptops at that time. Supervisor grabbed the laptop he took from Staff 3. Youth A
then swung around and hit her in the face with the laptop. She was not sure if it was
accidental or on purpose. Staff 1 stepped in. Supervisor was not sure if Staff 1 was
trying to restrain him or just create space. Youth B was there trying to push past
Staff 1 and Staff 2. Supervisor did not see a restraint. She said there was a big
cluster of staff and students by the wall. Youth A did not have any injuries. Later that
night Youth A said Staff 1 choked him while he was up against the wall. She
reported Youth A has a safety plan that tells them what they need to do when he is
escalated.
The Complainant was interviewed on 6/1/22. She did not provide any additional
information.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/1/22. He reported Youth A
was choked by Staff 1 and he saw it. Youth B jumped in to get Staff 1 away from
Youth A. Staff 1 choked Youth A when Youth A went to get her keys. They were
digging in her pockets to get her keys. He said Staff 1 choked Youth A either with an
arm around his neck or two hands on his neck. He said they were doing a lot of stuff
that night, but he could not remember what they did or who else was working. Youth
C said he is friends with Youth A but that he is somewhat scared of him.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/1/22. He reported a lot
happened the night Youth A alleged he was choked. The youth were hanging out in
the living room trying to stay up late. Youth A talked the other boys into not taking
their medication so they could stay awake. The boys were in the living room listening
to music. Third shift staff arrived. The staff were Staff 2 and Staff 4. Staff 1 was
called over to help. Staff 1 placed herself between Youth A and the other staff and
youth. Staff 3 said he was not present when Youth A hit Supervisor with the laptop.
Youth D was interviewed in person at his school by the DHHS Worker. This
consultant was present by phone. Youth D said staff 1 was choking Youth A. Youth
A had his side against the wall and Staff 1 had her arm around Youth A's neck. He
could not see Staff 1's other arm. Youth B approached to stop Staff 1 and Staff 2
from restraining Youth A. He said he is friends with Youth A and when Youth A does
something he will do it too.
5

Video Reviewed:
A video from the night of 5/25/22 around 11:22 pm was viewed. A couple of youth
and several staff are in the milieu. Youth A grabs a laptop computer from Staff 3.
The lights are turned off at the same time making it difficult to see what is going on.
There is a group of people around Youth A. Staff 1 appears to move Youth A away
from the group and toward the wall. Her arms are not observed on Youth A’s neck.
Documentation Reviewed:
 Incident Report: Dated 5/25/22, written by Staff 1. The information provided in
the Incident Report was the same information provided in Staff 1’s interview.
 Staff 1’s file documentation indicated she was hired on 12/30/15. She did not
have any disciplinary action and her last restraint training was 9/29/21.
 Youth A’s Safety Plan: triggers for Youth A are the passing of his mother, not
having access to Youth B, and being told no.
DHHS did not have any findings.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4159 Resident restraint.
(2) Resident restraint shall be performed in a manner that is
safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity of the
minor child’s behavior, chronological and developmental
age, size, gender, physical condition, medical condition,
psychiatric condition, and personal history, including any
history of trauma, and done in a manner consistent with the
resident’s treatment plan.
ANALYSIS: Based on the staff interviews and the video there is no indication
that Staff 1 choked Youth A while she was trying to restrain him.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Two youth, who are dating, were in a room together without any supervision.
INVESTIGATION:
While at the facility on 5/26/22 conducting an unannounced visit for the above
investigation Youth A was observed siting on his bed with Youth B lying next to him
on the bed. Staff were observed to be in the living room area. The two staff in the
house could not see down the hallway or into Youth A’s bedroom from their location.
When questioned the staff told the program director (PD) a third staff had been
monitoring Youth A’s bedroom but had left due to shift change and did not tell the
6

other staff she was leaving. PD stated the two youth were not supposed to be
unsupervised. The PD stated the youth refused to leave the room. He reported there
are concerns with the two of them being in a room together. He stated they should
have a staff sit in the doorway.
During Youth A’s interview on 6/2/22 he reported that Youth B was in his bedroom
when this consultant visited him. He said technically Youth B lives at the other house
and they are not supposed to be in each other’s bedrooms. If they do not follow this
rule the staff ask them to separate. If they do not separate, then an Incident Report
is completed. He reported Youth B is still staying in his room and staff need to watch
them 24/7. He admitted the two were left alone last week for about 25 minutes. He
reported Staff 3 and Staff 5 were working at the time. He did not think Staff 3 and
Staff 5 knew they had to watch them.
During his interview on 6/1/22 CA indicated Youth A did not have a safety plan. He
reported Youth B was from the other house. She was able to get into Youth A's
house by following them in and refused to leave for days. He was unaware that this
consultant found Youth A and Youth B in Youth A’s bedroom without staff
supervision.
During the Therapists interview on 6/1/22 she reported Youth A was given boundary
precautions due to his interactions with Youth B and he did not like that. His negative
behaviors increased after the precautions were put in place. The precautions
indicated Youth A and Youth B were not to be around each other. If the youth
refused to be separated staff had to be right there with them. The first precautions
were put in place on 4/20/22 and were recently updated to indicate they could not
have any contact. These precautions were documented on a form that was given to
staff. It was e-mailed to all staff and a copy was put on the clipboard that staff carry
with them. When the two youth have been in Youth A's bedroom the staff sit in the
doorway. They also encourage Youth B to return to her house. She has spoken to
both the youth to try to separate them. Today Youth B left Youth A's house.
During Staff 1’s interview on 6/1/22 she stated when Youth A finally went to his room
on 5/25/22 Youth B went with him. Staff 1 sat right in the doorway. If she needed to
get up she had another staff switch with her.
When Supervisor was interviewed on 6/1/22 she stated Youth A had a peer
restriction that says Youth A and Youth B cannot be around each other. If they
refuse to follow it then the staff supervise them the best they can. She has not seen
a time when Youth A and Youth B have been alone together. All the staff are aware
of the plans.
During Staff 3’s interview on 6/1/22, he reported Youth A and Youth B are not
supposed to have contact. Youth B saw Youth A outside and the two got together
then Youth B never left. Youth B stayed in Youth A’s bedroom on the night of the
25th. When he left Youth B and Youth C were in Youth A’s bedroom. The youth were
7

being supervised by staff. He reported staff are always watching Youth A and Youth
B. Staff 3 admitted he was working on 5/26/22 when this consultant visited the
house. He reported Staff 6 was supervising Youth A and Youth B when he came on
shift at 2pm. She never told him when she left so he did not know they were not
being supervised by anyone.
Video Reviewed:
Video from 5/26/22 at 2:51pm shows Staff 3 watching the previous staff who was
watching Youth A, leave the house. At 2:54pm Youth A and Youth B go into Youth
A’s bedroom without a staff. The two of them come out then go back in. At 2:58pm
Staff 3 is seen going down the hallway and leaning as if to look into Youth A’s
bedroom then walks away. Staff 3 is seen in the hallway again but never goes near
Youth A’s bedroom. This consultant and PD enter the doorway of Youth A’s
bedroom at 3:23pm. No staff are observed in Youth A’s doorway or doing checks on
Youth A from 2:58pm until 3:23pm.
Documents Reviewed:
 Safety plan updated 5/17/22. Staff will do 10-minute increased checks. Youth
A is not to have contact with Youth B.
 Clinical Assessment for Peer Boundaries dated 5/6/22. This document was
provided by Therapist. Staff are to be between Youth A and his peers at all
times.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions
required by these administrative rules and in the agency's
program statement and to provide for the continual needs,
protection, and supervision of residents.
ANALYSIS: Despite Youth A’s safety plan staff were not monitoring Youth
A’s bedroom or doing checks on Youth A between 2:58pm and
3:23pm. The facility also did not sufficiently address Youth B
refusing to leave Youth A’s bedroom. Additionally, the CA
reported that Youth A was not on a safety plan when he was.
These factors indicate a lack of sufficient staffing to keep Youth
A and Youth B safe and supervised.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
2020C0223043; CAP approved 8/25/20
8

ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Staff were viewed on video not completing checks.
INVESTIGATION:
Video Reviewed:
Youth A and Youth B were in Youth A’s bedroom unsupervised from 2:55pm to
3:23pm. Staff 3 went down the hallway at 2:58pm. The next time a staff looked in on
Youth A and Youth B was at 3:23pm when this consultant and the PD entered Youth
A’s doorway.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4127 Staff-to-resident ratio.
(4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval
checks shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
ANALYSIS: The video showed staff not completing checks between 2:58pm
and 3:23pm.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan it is recommended no change
be made to this CCI’s license status.
